no_changes_reason: Issue #159 code changes are clean, minimal, and consistent with existing patterns. APP_VERSION_DISPLAY constant follows KISS/YAGNI principles. Version sections in InfoModal and MobileInfoContent match the styling conventions of adjacent sections (bg-gray-50 for desktop, bg-white with border for mobile). Tests are comprehensive with 4 cases covering desktop/mobile and version-set/unset scenarios. No refactoring improvements identified within Issue #159 scope.

review_details.next_config_js: Clean addition of NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_VERSION via require('./package.json'). Well-commented. Follows standard Next.js env pattern.
review_details.worktree_detail_refactored_tsx: APP_VERSION_DISPLAY constant is well-named, properly documented, and correctly uses ternary with 'v' prefix and '-' fallback. Version sections in both InfoModal and MobileInfoContent follow existing section patterns exactly.
review_details.test_file: 4 test cases covering both desktop (InfoModal) and mobile (MobileInfoContent) views, with both version-set and version-unset scenarios. Uses vi.resetModules() + dynamic import correctly for module-level constant testing.

summary: No refactoring needed. Issue #159 implementation is clean and follows existing codebase conventions. All static analysis checks pass and all 4 tests pass.
